publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1684# Iain Smith: Recycling in Fife—That the Parliament notes with disappointment that, according to the Accounts Commission Performance Indicators for 1999/2000 for the percentage of domestic waste recycled, Fife Council has fallen from 4th in 1996-97, when it inherited the award-winning record of the former North East Fife District Council, to bottom of the league in 1999-2000 at 1.6% and urges Fife Council to develop a strategy to increase recycling and meet its obligations under the European Landfill Directive.
S1M-1684# Recycling in Fife (lodged on 20 February 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-1684# Recycling in Fife (lodged on 20 February 2001) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1684# Iain Smith: Recycling in Fife—That the Parliament notes with disappointment that, according to the Accounts Commission Performance Indicators for 1999/2000 for the percentage of domestic waste recycled, Fife Council has fallen from 4th in 1996-97, when it inherited the award-winning record of the former North East Fife District Council, to bottom of the league in 1999-2000 at 1.6% and urges Fife Council to develop a strategy to increase recycling and meet its obligations under the European Landfill Directive. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Raffan, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1684# Recycling in Fife (lodged on 20 February 2001) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1684# Recycling in Fife (lodged on 20 February 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1684# Iain Smith: Recycling in Fife—That the Parliament notes with disappointment that, according to the Accounts Commission Performance Indicators for 1999/2000 for the percentage of domestic waste recycled, Fife Council has fallen from 4th in 1996-97, when it inherited the award-winning record of the former North East Fife District Council, to bottom of the league in 1999-2000 at 1.6% and urges Fife Council to develop a strategy to increase recycling and meet its obligations under the European Landfill Directive. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Raffan, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-1684# Recycling in Fife (lodged on 20 February 2001) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1684# Recycling in Fife (lodged on 20 February 2001) Robert Brown*

S1M-1684# Iain Smith: Recycling in Fife—That the Parliament notes with disappointment that, according to the Accounts Commission Performance Indicators for 1999/2000 for the percentage of domestic waste recycled, Fife Council has fallen from 4th in 1996-97, when it inherited the award-winning record of the former North East Fife District Council, to bottom of the league in 1999-2000 at 1.6% and urges Fife Council to develop a strategy to increase recycling and meet its obligations under the European Landfill Directive. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Raffan, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Robert Brown
